title: Task​
content: </> type Task = function | Instance | RbxScriptConnection | table Task that can be passed to a variety of methods that can be cleaned up

title: Finalizer​
content: </> type Finalizer = function | string Function or string that will point to a method that will be passed finalizer arguments

title: Key​
content: </> type Key = string | number | userdata | table Key that can be used to assign specific tasks

title: working​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Cleaner.working: boolean Will be set to true if the cleaner object is currently doing work

title: new​
content: </> Cleaner.new() → () Creates a new cleaner object

title: is​
content: </> Cleaner.is(obj: any) → boolean Returns whether or not the passed argument is a cleaner

title: add​
content: </> Cleaner:add( task: Task, finalizer?: Finalizer,-- If nil, it will check for a destroy method in an object if it's a table ...?: any-- Optional arguments passed to the finalizer when called if they aren't overwritten by finalize ) → Task-- Returns the passed task so you can write less code Adds a task to the cleaner

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"No finalizer found for %s (typeof: %s)" "Attempted to add duplicate %s (typeof: %s)"

title: has​
content: </> Cleaner:has(task: Task) → boolean Returns whether or not a task has been added to the cleaner

title: set​
content: </> Cleaner:set( key: Key, task: Task, ...?: any-- Optional arguments passed to the finalizer when called if they aren't overwritten by finalize ) → Task Adds a task and assigns a key to the task in the cleaner

title: get​
content: </> Cleaner:get(key: Key) → Task | nil Gets the task assigned to the key

title: extract​
content: </> Cleaner:extract(key: Key) → Task Removes the task at the key from the task list

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Key (%s) is not assigned to any task"

title: finalize​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Cleaner:finalize( key: Key, ...?: any-- Optional arguments that can be used to overwrite any that were included in the set call ) → Task Finalizes the task at the key and passes the args to the finalizer if included. This can yield if the finalizer yields.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Key (%s) is not assigned to any task"

title: work​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Cleaner:work() → () Starts working on the task list. This can yield if any finalizers yield.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Attempted to call work when already working"

title: destroy​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Cleaner:destroy() → () Cleans up the cleaner object by calling work and setting the destroyed field to true. This can yield if any finalizers yield.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Attempted to call destroy when already destroying or destroyed"
